main event: An unidentified aerial phenomenon was reported in Xenia, Ohio, observed on May 19, 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared to be an intense white light about the size of a quarter moon., The object moved slowly horizontally from left to right., The observer initially thought the object was a star before realizing it was moving., The object made no sound during the sighting., The observer described the light as strange, with no changes in brightness or size during the observation.
witness description: The observer was a 45-year-old married university professor.
